title: Data Recovery
content:
I was using Firefox as my default browser and had data like bookmarks, add-ons for everyday use, etc. but after I reinstalled windows and installed Firefox again I forgot which email was link to my data as I had multiple emails logged in. Now I have tried 2-3 emails which didn't work in bringing my data back and I don't remember the password of my other emails, I can recover them by forgot password but I it says resetting password will clear history bookmarks, etc.| I can afford to loose history and saved passwords but is there a way I can get Firefox back to my configuration and add-ons, etc I was using previously?

PS: I do have windows.old file after windows installation-If it could help./
creator: varunvora9898859131

title: how can i add contextual menu items?
content:
hi, when i right click and see the contextual menu, i no longer see great options and i miss them. (eg, scan with virus total, or google reverse image lookup)

how can i add such items to my contextual menu in firefox browser? thanks!
creator: coatli

title: Tab sync doesn't work because of CreditCards?
content:
Hello, Firefox on Mac doesn't sync tabs because of the following problem:

Sync.Synchronizer DEBUG Updating enabled engines failed: Error: CreditCards is not initialized. Please restart if you flip the pref manually.(resource://autofill/FormAutofillStorageBase.jsm:2018:21) JS Stack trace: get@FormAutofillStorageBase.jsm:2018:21

Sync.ErrorHandler ERROR Sync encountered an error: Error: CreditCards is not initialized. Please restart if you flip the pref manually.(resource://autofill/FormAutofillStorageBase.jsm:2018:21) JS Stack trace: get@FormAutofillStorageBase.jsm:2018:21

Do you have an idea what's wrong here? FYI: I use a custom user.js file.

Thanks
creator: 4d7198fe-f765-470f-951a-e8f366a2c874

title: Unableto Log On to two purticular websites  Coles and Target Australia
content:

Yours Sincerely Anne Martyn

title: Something in Firefox blocking WordPress admin functionality
content: Hi, I made the mistake of selecting a checkbox in a browser popup window that I thought was just asking me if I didn't want to be reminded about something everytime I tried to do it ... but it seems that's not the case, and unfortunately I cannot find the setting to reverse the decision, and it is stopping me from deleting wordpress plugins from the wordpress admin of my site ... when I now try to select the plugin "delete" link, it is unresponsive ... can you think of which thing I might have selected in what popup window of the browser, and how I could reverse this? I tried a few things but nothing worked.
creator: galacticpresident

title: Still Cannot Install Firefox
content:

title: Hacked browser account
